Module contents¶

orch_serv - the library for creating services and an orchestrator that organized their interaction

class orch_serv.AsyncBlock(pre_handler_function: Callable[[BaseOrchServMsg], Awaitable[BaseOrchServMsg | None]] | None = None, post_handler_function: Callable[[BaseOrchServMsg], Awaitable[BaseOrchServMsg | None]] | None = None, logger: Logger | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: AsyncBaseBlock, ABC

in the flow where this block participates

function called before this block’s handler

] :attr _post_handler_function: function called after this block’s handler :type _post_handler_function: Optional[

Callable[[BaseOrchServMsg], Awaitable[Optional[BaseOrchServMsg]]]

]

functions is hidden

get_list_flow() → str[source]¶

get_next() → AsyncBaseBlock | None[source]¶

the method returns the next block :return: next block if exist :rtype: Optional[AsyncBaseBlock]

async handle(message: BaseOrchServMsg) → None[source]¶
A function that determines which handler should now process

the message based on the source from which the message came.

Parameters:

message (BaseOrchServMsg) – message for processing

Returns:

nothing

Raises:

FlowException – exception if a message with the wrong source is passed to the flow

property is_execute_after_nullable_process_msg: bool¶

Execute if the block handler did not return a message :return: true if it should be executed with previous msg after empty process msg :rtype: bool

property post_handler_function: Callable[[BaseOrchServMsg], Awaitable[BaseOrchServMsg | None]] | None¶
A class property that returns an asynchronous function that will be

called after this block`s handler.

the function should only take one parameter msg: BaseOrchServMsg if the process does not return a message to the function,

the message sent to the handler will be transferred

if it is not mandatory to execute, redefine

the variable is_execute_after_nullable_process_msg = False in your block

Returns:

async function if exist pre_handler_function

Return type:

Optional[Callable[[BaseOrchServMsg], Awaitable[Optional[BaseOrchServMsg]]]]

property pre_handler_function: Callable[[BaseOrchServMsg], Awaitable[BaseOrchServMsg | None]] | None¶
A class property that returns an asynchronous function that will be

called before being sent to the main handler.

the function should only take one parameter msg: BaseOrchServMsg Attention!!! The function must return a message object.

If the function does not return a message, then the handler will not be called

Returns:

async function if exist pre_handler_function

Return type:

Optional[Callable[[BaseOrchServMsg], Awaitable[Optional[BaseOrchServMsg]]]]

set_next(handler: AsyncBaseBlock | type[AsyncBaseBlock]) → AsyncBaseBlock[source]¶

Save next handler after this handler in flow :param handler: block for execution after current :type handler: Union[AsyncBaseBlock, Type[AsyncBaseBlock]] :return: AsyncBaseBlock :raise Exception: some exception if error in time init handler if

handler provided as type

Raises:

TypeError – if handler not is instance of type SyncBaseBlock

async handle(message: BaseOrchServMsg, is_force_return: bool = False) → BaseOrchServMsg | None[source]¶

Message processing method

!!! the presence of a target in the message has higher priority

than the presence of a flow

Parameters:

  • message (BaseOrchServMsg) – message to process

  • is_force_return (bool) – always return a message

Returns:

message if an error occurred while processing the message if is_force_return is False

Return type:

Optional[BaseOrchServMsg]

class orch_serv.BaseOrchServMsg(*, body: SubPydanticBodyModel, header: SubPydanticHeaderModel | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel, Generic[SubPydanticBodyModel, SubPydanticHeaderModel]

Base message class for processing and to use the library :attr body: message body to be processed with basic information :type SubPydanticBodyModel: :attr header: message header with data to be processed :type SubPydanticHeaderModel: :example: >>> # How to use BaseOrchServMsg to create a custom message for your needs >>> # The first step: create body model your msg >>> from pydantic import BaseModel >>> class MyBody(BaseModel): >>> body_option: str # any type you need >>> # The second step: create header model your >>> # msg (is optional if you need a header) >>> class MyHeader(BaseModel): >>> header_option: str # any type you need >>> # The third step: create your msg >>> # The first option: >>> MyTypeFir = BaseOrchServMsg[MyBody, MyHeader] >>> example_my_type = {“body”: { >>> “body_option”: “test_body”}, >>> “header”:{ >>> “header_option”:”test_header”}} >>> my_value = MyTypeFir(**example_my_type) >>> # First option without header >>> MyTypeFirWithoutHeader = BaseOrchServMsg[MyBody, BaseModel] >>> # The second option >>> class MyTypeSec(BaseOrchServMsg): >>> body: MyBody >>> header: MyHeader >>> MyTypeSec(**example_my_type)

_abc_impl = <_abc._abc_data object>¶
body: SubPydanticBodyModel¶
get_command() → str | None[source]¶

### For service ### Method returns the name of the processor that should execute the given message :return: title processor to execution :rtype: str

get_flow() → str | None[source]¶

### For orchestrator ### Method returns the name of the flow to which the given message belongs !!! the message must contain a field that determines whether

the message belongs to some flow

Returns:

title flow

Return type:

str

get_source() → str | None[source]¶

### For orchestrator ### Adding the source to the message where

the message was processed (will be processed)

Method is required to be implemented pair method to method set_source

Raises:

NotImplementedError – if not override

Returns:

the method returns the string that the set method

Return type:

str

Example:

>>> obj: BaseOrchServMsg
>>> source = 'test_source'
>>> obj.set_source(source)
>>> assert obj.get_source() == source
>>> # True
get_target() → str | None[source]¶

### For orchestrator ### Method returns the name of the command that should execute the given message mandatory if you don’t need a flow but want to execute only one

block for a message

Returns:

title block to execution

Return type:

str

header: SubPydanticHeaderModel | None¶
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

set_source(source: str) → None[source]¶

### For orchestrator ### Method set source to message to identify previous step on flow Method is required to be implemented for more information see method get_source

Parameters:

source (str) – source where the message was processed (will be processed)

Raises:

NotImplementedError – if not override method

Returns:

nothing

property default_post_processor: CommandHandlerPostProcessStrategy | AsyncCommandHandlerPostProcessStrategy¶
class orch_serv.Step(obj: Callable, **kwargs: Any)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for configuration Step of Stepper flow :attr __obj: obj object that contains logic :type __obj: Callable :attr __kwargs: additional kwargs for execution step

which are not returned from the previous step

Example:

>>> def example_function(val: int , arg_1: int = 1) -> int:
>>>     return val + arg_1
>>> step_1 = Step(example_function )
>>> step_1.execute(1) # return: 2
>>> step_2 = Step(example_function, arg_1=2 )
>>> step_1.execute(1) # return: 3
__kwargs: dict[str, Any] = {}¶
__obj: Callable¶
execute(data_to_execute: Any) → Any[source]¶
property kwargs: dict[str, Any]¶
property obj: Callable¶

of step n is the output of step n

property is_execute_if_empty: bool¶

if the current step did not return anything

_post_handler_function: Callable[[BaseOrchServMsg], BaseOrchServMsg | None] | None = None¶
_pre_handler_function: Callable[[BaseOrchServMsg], BaseOrchServMsg | None] | None = None¶
_process_logic(block: SyncBaseBlock, message: BaseOrchServMsg) → None[source]¶
Auxiliary function in which the logic of working with additional

functions is hidden

Parameters:

  • block (SyncBaseBlock) – block for processing

  • message (BaseOrchServMsg) – message for processing

Returns:

nothing

get_list_flow() → str[source]¶

Method return str flow :return: str

get_next() → SyncBaseBlock | None[source]¶

the method returns the next block :return: next block if exist :rtype: Optional[SyncBaseBlock]

handle(message: BaseOrchServMsg) → None[source]¶
A function that determines which handler should now process

the message based on the source from which the message came.

Parameters:

message (BaseOrchServMsg) – message for processing

Returns:

nothing

Raises:

FlowException – exception if a message with the wrong source is passed to the flow

property is_execute_after_nullable_process_msg: bool¶

Execute if the block handler did not return a message :return: true if it should be executed with previous msg after empty process msg :rtype: bool

property post_handler_function: Callable[[BaseOrchServMsg], BaseOrchServMsg | None] | None¶
A class property that returns an synchronous function that will be

called after this block`s handler.

the function should only take one parameter msg: BaseOrchServMsg if the process does not return a message to the function,

the message sent to the handler will be transferred

if it is not mandatory to execute, redefine

the variable is_execute_after_nullable_process_msg = False in your block

Returns:

sync function if exist pre_handler_function

Return type:

Optional[ Callable[[BaseOrchServMsg], Optional[BaseOrchServMsg]]]

property pre_handler_function: Callable[[BaseOrchServMsg], BaseOrchServMsg | None] | None¶
A class property that returns an synchronous function that will be

called before being sent to the main handler.

the function should only take one parameter msg: BaseOrchServMsg Attention!!! The function must return a message object.

If the function does not return a message, then the handler will not be called

Returns:

sync function if exist pre_handler_function

Return type:

Optional[ Callable[[BaseOrchServMsg], Optional[BaseOrchServMsg]]]

set_next(handler: SyncBaseBlock | type[SyncBaseBlock]) → SyncBaseBlock[source]¶

Save next handler after this handler in flow :param handler: block for execution after current :type handler: Union[SyncBaseBlock, Type[SyncBaseBlock]] :return: SyncBaseBlock :raise Exception: some exception if error in time init handler if

handler provided as type

Raises:

TypeError – if handler not is instance of type SyncBaseBlock

class orch_serv.SyncOrchestrator(flows: ModuleType | list | None = None, blocks: ModuleType | list | None = None, logger: Logger | None = None, flows_to_ignore: list[str] | None = None, blocks_to_ignore: list[str] | None = None, default_flow: str | None = None, default_block: str | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Orchestrator class for build service

alias of SyncBlock

_default_block: str = None¶
_default_flow: str = None¶
_flows: dict[str, type[SyncFlow | AsyncFlow] | SyncFlow | AsyncFlow] = {}¶
static _generate_data(data_to_process: ModuleType | list, type_to_compare: type | tuple[type, ...], attribute_to_get: str, names_to_ignore: list[str] | None = None, type_data: str = 'block') → dict[str, type[SyncFlow | AsyncFlow | SyncBlock | AsyncBlock]][source]¶

The method prepares the data for the orchestrator to work Converts data from a list or retrieves from a module :param data_to_process: :param type_to_compare: :param attribute_to_get: name in object :param names_to_ignore: class names to ignore when processing :type names_to_ignore: list[str] :param type_data: name for information exception if will be raised :type type_data: str :raise TypeError: if the data to be processed contains

the wrong type (and was not added to the exception)

Raises:

  • UniqueNameException – if the data contains objects with non-unique identifiers

  • WrongTypeException – if a module is passed and not a list for generating data

  • NoDateException – if there is no data after processing

Returns:

converted data to dictionary format to work with

Return type:

dict[str, type[Union[Flow, SyncBlock, AsyncBlock]]]

_targets: dict[str, type[SyncBlock | AsyncBlock] | SyncBlock | AsyncBlock] = {}¶
_validate_data() → None[source]¶

Checks the types of objects in the flow and targets the synchronous orchestrator not to redistribute a synchronous flows or blocks and vice versa :raise WorkTypeMismatchException: if incorrect type

property blocks: ModuleType | list | None¶
property flows: ModuleType | list | None¶

list allowed blocks

get_list_flows() → list[str][source]¶
Returns:

list allowed flows

handle(message: BaseOrchServMsg, is_force_return: bool = False) → BaseOrchServMsg | None[source]¶

Message processing method

!!! the presence of a target in the message has higher priority

than the presence of a flow

Parameters:

  • message (BaseOrchServMsg) – message to process

  • is_force_return (bool) – always return a message

Returns:

message if an error occurred while processing the message if is_force_return is False

Return type:

Optional[BaseOrchServMsg]
